42402f68-8587-421d-be44-9abe8127cfc6.name: GHG Protocol - Sample Emissions Inventory Reporting Template

711af679-d399-4a1c-b56a-7172e4f8947f.name: Has this inventory been verified by an accredited third party?

5bbcead3-bd0b-4844-a087-32c37ead1aa4.name: Have any facilities, operations and/or emissions sources been excluded from this inventory?

edb9d8a6-7e62-4dea-8181-632c9b75d80b.name: Reporting period covered by this inventory

bfdb796b-3f7d-4c40-aa59-ec90667c1204.name: Which consolidation approach was chosen (check each consolidation approach for which your company is reporting emissions.)

e1c98442-35a9-49e2-a33d-c005cec66bd3.name: List of all legal entities or facilities over which reporting company has equity share, financial control or operational control

2fab39c5-449a-49bd-9bad-b7d1f9019ca8.name: Does reporting company have financial control?

a33924ca-e3d3-49ca-b3ff-af65572ac081.name: Does reporting company have operational control?

c8b528ec-0a8d-4843-9b55-c6c1a4a90bc0.name: If the reporting companyâ€™s parent company does not report emissions, include an organizational diagram that clearly defines relationship of the reporting subsidiary as well as other subsidiaries

85c52a47-2ff6-406f-96e8-8a68783fb2b9.name: Are Scope 3 emissions included in this inventory?

7b2cd79e-667d-4efd-b857-cf96615a1e9f.name: If yes, which types of activities are included in Scope 3 emissions?

2e40bbcf-ff2a-4170-aa04-0801d506d1e9.name: Current year emissions (independent of any GHG trades such as sales, purchases, transfers, or banking of allowances)

4ad97131-23b4-42cc-90d4-2e0eb493962a.name: Direct CO2 emissions from Biogenic combustion (mtCO2)

f655b2bf-7466-4e5f-9031-e741903c8c9d.name: Scope 1: Direct Emissions from Owned/Controlled Operations

88d3b04b-d980-42ce-baab-dcc3a9a15e01.name: Scope 2: Indirect Emissions from the Use of Purchased Electricity, Steam, Heating and Cooling

b7507cf8-8599-4568-b8d4-ac5c9b423ebc.name: Emissions disaggregated by facility (recommended for individual facilities with stationary combustion emissions over 10,000 mtCO2e)

39904225-930b-4960-a82b-fecf6e3f1613.name: Emissions attributable to own generation of electricity, heat, or steam that is sold or transferred to another organization

03e3b852-5531-4eaa-b70f-5faaadf30430.name: Emissions attributable to the generation of electricity, heat or steam that is purchased for re-sale to non-end users

76d4fff8-b17e-4ef7-b2a4-44fefa25b82f.name: Emissions from GHGs not covered by the Kyoto Protocol (e.g., CFCs, NOx,)

d822b1c8-a074-48fa-adb8-271ff5e1d875.name: Information on the causes of emissions changes that did not trigger a base year emissions recalculation (e.g., process changes, efficiency improvements, plant closures)

60522522-af6e-4877-9b6d-7759ec5cb661.name: GHG emissions data for all years between the base year and the reporting year (including details of and reasons for recalculations, if appropriate)

b2beb5b9-f5fd-40c0-8166-6b681062b8b9.name: Relevant ratio performance indicators (e.g. emissions per kilowatt-hour generated, sales, etc.)

75b562d1-170e-41b0-a947-83f28aa84eff.name: An outline of any GHG management/reduction programs or strategies

1bdfa09d-2a1c-40ac-9b27-c5d87dd9ba50.name: Clarification of company-determined policy for making base year emissions recalculations

d2a18439-7cb5-403b-bac1-bf5845c64bef.name: Context for any significant emissions changes that trigger base year emissions recalculations

6823fa74-842f-4fbe-a5f5-72690180eb81.name: Methodologies used to calculate or measure emissions other than those provided by the GHG Protocol

5078f150-ff07-4ef7-a6aa-e8d7bee46313.name: Information on any contractual provisions addressing GHG-related risks and obligations

a9c9ace6-2088-489b-b9a1-e3a7a27125a0.name: An outline of any external assurance provided and a copy of any verification statement, if applicable, of the reported emissions data

3dd1a5f2-f2d8-459d-a8b1-1bdbfc8f4d67.name: Information on the quality of the inventory (e.g., information on the causes and magnitude of uncertainties in emission estimates) and an outline of policies in place to improve inventory quality

1f3c93ff-43a4-4587-b7e8-a1899070fea1.name: Information on offsets that have been purchased or developed outside the inventory boundary

482a4bc4-4f61-4670-a493-368a0f381439.name: Were the offsets verified/certified and/or approved by an external GHG program (e.g., CDM)

0fad4b07-33d1-4b52-a580-69986781e8d0.name: Information on reductions inside the inventory boundary that have been sold/transferred as offsets to a third party.

5f26084c-6857-4261-98f1-7d8d2baff299.name: Were the offsets verified/certified and/or approved by an external GHG program (e.g., CDM)

properties.Description: Extraction, production, and transportation of goods and services purchased or acquired by the reporting company in the reporting year, not otherwise included in Categories 2 - 8
properties.Minimum Boundary: All upstream (cradle-to-gate) emissions of purchased goods and services

properties.Description: Extraction, production, and transportation of capital goods purchased or acquired by the reporting company in the reporting year
properties.Minimum Boundary: All upstream (cradle-to-gate) emissions of purchased capital goods

ef67c6ca-057c-4c9d-b8a7-97852652ca47.name: 3. Fuel- and energy related activities (not included in scope 1 or scope 2)

properties.Description: Extraction, production, and transportation of fuels and energy purchased or acquired by the reporting company in the reporting year, not already accounted for in scope 1 or scope 2, including: a. Upstream emissions of purchased fuels (extraction, production, and transportation of fuels consumed by the reporting company) b. Upstream emissions of purchased electricity (extraction, production, and transportation of fuels consumed in the generation of electricity, steam, heating, and cooling consumed by the reporting company) c. Transmission and distribution (T&D) losses (generation of electricity, steam, heating and cooling that is consumed (i.e., lost) in a T&D system) â€“ reported by end user d. Generation of purchased electricity that is sold to end users (generation of electricity, steam, heating, and cooling that is purchased by the reporting company and sold to end users) â€“ reported by utility company or energy retailer only
properties.Minimum Boundary: a. For upstream emissions of purchased fuels: All upstream (cradle-to-gate) emissions of purchased fuels (from raw material extraction up to the point of, but excluding combustion) b. For upstream emissions of purchased electricity: All upstream (cradle-to-gate) emissions of purchased fuels (from raw material extraction up to the point of, but excluding, combustion by a power generator) c. For T&D losses: All upstream (cradle-to-gate) emissions of energy consumed in a T&D system, including emissions from combustion d. For generation of purchased electricity that is sold to end users: Emissions from the generation of purchased energy

properties.Description: Transportation and distribution of products purchased by the reporting company in the reporting year between a companyâ€™s tier 1 suppliers and its own operations (in vehicles and facilities not owned or controlled by the reporting company) â€¢ Transportation and distribution services purchased by the reporting company in the reporting year, including inbound logistics, outbound logistics (e.g., of sold products), and transportation and distribution between a companyâ€™s own facilities (in vehicles and facilities not owned or controlled by the reporting company)
properties.Minimum Boundary: The scope 1 and scope 2 emissions of transportation and distribution providers that occur during use of vehicles and facilities (e.g., from energy use) ; Optional: The life cycle emissions associated with manufacturing vehicles, facilities, or infrastructure

properties.Description: Disposal and treatment of waste generated in the reporting companyâ€™s operations in the reporting year (in facilities not owned or controlled by the reporting company
properties.Minimum Boundary: The scope 1 and scope 2 emissions of waste management suppliers that occur during disposal or treatment ; Optional: Emissions from transportation of waste

properties.Description: Transportation of employees for business-related activities during the reporting year (in vehicles not owned or operated by the reporting company
properties.Minimum Boundary: The scope 1 and scope 2 emissions of transportation carriers that occur during use of vehicles (e.g., from energy use) ; Optional: The life cycle emissions associated with manufacturing vehicles or infrastructure

properties.Description: Transportation of employees between their homes and their worksites during the reporting year (in vehicles not owned or operated by the reporting company)
properties.Minimum Boundary: The scope 1 and scope 2 emissions of employees and transportation providers that occur during use of vehicles (e.g., from energy use) ; Optional: Emissions from employee teleworking

properties.Description: Operation of assets leased by the reporting company (lessee) in the reporting year and not included in scope 1 and scope 2 â€“ reported by lessee
properties.Minimum Boundary: The scope 1 and scope 2 emissions of lessors that occur during the reporting companyâ€™s operation of leased assets (e.g., from energy use) ; Optional: The life cycle emissions associated with manufacturing or constructing leased assets

properties.Description: Transportation and distribution of products sold by the reporting company in the reporting year between the reporting companyâ€™s operations and the end consumer (if not paid for by the reporting company), including retail and storage (in vehicles and facilities not owned or controlled by the reporting company)
properties.Minimum Boundary: The scope 1 and scope 2 emissions of transportation providers, distributors, and retailers that occur during use of vehicles and facilities (e.g., from energy use) ; Optional: The life cycle emissions associated with manufacturing vehicles, facilities, or infrastructure

properties.Description: Processing of intermediate products sold in the reporting year by downstream companies (e.g., manufacturers)
properties.Minimum Boundary: The scope 1 and scope 2 emissions of downstream companies that occur during processing (e.g., from energy use)

properties.Description: End use of goods and services sold by the reporting company in the reporting year
properties.Minimum Boundary: The direct use-phase emissions of sold products over their expected lifetime (i.e., the scope 1 and scope 2 emissions of end users that occur from the use of: products that directly consume energy (fuels or electricity) during use; fuels and feedstocks; and GHGs and products that contain or form GHGs that are emitted during use) ; Optional: The indirect use-phase emissions of sold products over their expected lifetime (i.e., emissions from the use of products that indirectly consume energy (fuels or electricity) during use)

properties.Description: Waste disposal and treatment of products sold by the reporting company (in the reporting year) at the end of their life
properties.Minimum Boundary: The scope 1 and scope 2 emissions of waste management companies that occur during disposal or treatment of sold products

properties.Description: Operation of assets owned by the reporting company (lessor) and leased to other entities in the reporting year, not included in scope 1 and scope 2 â€“ reported by lessor
properties.Minimum Boundary: The scope 1 and scope 2 emissions of lessees that occur during operation of leased assets (e.g., from energy use) ; Optional: The life cycle emissions associated with manufacturing or constructing leased assets

properties.Description: Operation of franchises in the reporting year, not included in scope 1 and scope 2 â€“ reported by franchisor
properties.Minimum Boundary: The scope 1 and scope 2 emissions of franchisees that occur during operation of franchises (e.g., from energy use) ; Optional: The life cycle emissions associated with manufacturing or constructing franchises

properties.Description: Operation of investments (including equity and debt investments and project finance) in the reporting year, not included in scope 1 or scope 2
properties.Minimum Boundary: See the description of category 15 (Investments) in section 5.5 for the required and optional boundaries
